column4: oddly, the debian package seems to still be around; packages in ubuntu usually are just rebadged debian packages
does it use qt 3 or qt 4?
launchpad does have a package compiled for 11.04, x86 and x64, but I kind of want software I'm using to be in a repository, so it gets updated and stuff
it's odd, there is a package for oneiric and maverick, just not natty
it uses Qt4, or at least that's what the changelogs indicate
there isn't one on the kdbg project page
I think you're right... the ubuntu build is linked against Qt3
the current version was built against Qt3, which might have been jettisoned in Natty, therefore it could no longer be built
the reason it is in oneiric is because upstream moved to 4, and they bumped the package from 2.2 to 2.5
basically, the maintainers failed to bump the package before natty froze, so the old version had to get bumped off
but it's likely somehow has a ppa of the new version, i think
it's unfortunate but ubuntu hasn't always been the best keeping up with kde
to me it's not a KDE issue... it's a development issue. GDB is an aweful program to use, many say "just use emacs", other than that we have DDD which was ugly 15 years ago
well at least I can stop freaking the hell out now
the solution might be to try building the oneiric source package
